list.comment:
feat(tests): add comprehensive test suite for blog app
- Implement model tests for Post and Category creation - Add form validation tests for PostForm (valid/invalid cases) - Cover URL resolution for all blog views (index, list, detail) - Write view tests for authenticated vs anonymous access - Use proper TestCase/SimpleTestCase separation and setUp for DRY

task.summary: Default task

feat: set up initial project structure
- Create 'accounts' and 'blog' Django apps - Add Dockerfile and docker-compose.yml - Configure containerized development environment

feat(accounts): implement custom user model with email authentication and profile
- Replace default User with email-based AbstractBaseUser - Add Profile model linked to User via OneToOne - Configure admin panel for User and Profile - Add post_save signal to auto-create Profile on user registration

feat(blog): implement core blog models and admin interface
- Add Category and Post models with relations to custom User - Include helper method `first_sentence` for content preview - Configure PostAdmin with list display, filters, search, and custom action - Register models in admin and set up basic URL routing

refactor(blog): link Post.author to Profile instead of User
- Update ForeignKey from User to Profile for semantic correctness - Author now references displayable identity (name, image) rather than auth model - Maintains SET_NULL behavior to preserve posts if profile is deleted

refactor(blog): link Post.author to Profile instead of User
- Update ForeignKey from User to Profile for semantic correctness - Author now references displayable identity (name, image) rather than auth model - Maintains SET_NULL behavior to preserve posts if profile is deleted

feat(blog): implement CRUD views and templates for blog posts
- Add class-based views: list, detail, create, update, delete - Protect editing views with LoginRequiredMixin - Enforce object-level permissions via 'blog.view_post' - Use PostForm for consistent input validation - Include basic templates and configure URL routing - Add sample redirect view to maktabkhooneh (for demo)

feat(blog): add DRF-based API v1 for blog posts
- Install and configure Django REST Framework in settings - Implement PostSerializer for JSON representation - Add function-based API views: post_list, post_detail - Configure URL routing under /api/v1/ - Include sample data and media for local testing

feat(blog): secure API with authentication and permission policies
- Configure DEFAULT_AUTHENTICATION_CLASSES and DEFAULT_PERMISSION_CLASSES in settings - Refactor serializers to use ModelSerializer for maintainability - Enable DRF browsable API login via /api-auth/ - Apply IsAuthenticatedOrReadOnly to post views: read public, write protected

refactor(blog): migrate API views to class-based APIView with full CRUD
- Replace function-based views with PostList and PostDetail APIView classes - Implement GET, POST, PUT, DELETE with proper error handling - Use get_object_or_404 for 404 responses and raise_exception for validation - Maintain IsAuthenticatedOrReadOnly permission policy - Centralize serializer via serializer_class attribute

feat(blog): implement and compare all DRF view patterns for Post API
- Add FBV, APIView, generic views, and ModelViewSet for Post - Configure consistent permissions and validation across all views - Set up URL routing for each pattern under /api/v1/ - Keep all view types for educational and architectural reference

fix(docker): correct PostgresSQL volume mount path
- Update volume path in docker-compose.yml to ensure stable DB persistence - Resolves permission or data-loss issues on container restart

feat(docs): add API documentation using DRF's built-in coreapi support
- Install coreapi and update requirements.txt - Configure include_docs_urls under /api-docs/ - Set documentation title to 'api sample' - Enable browsable, self-descriptive API reference for developers

feat(accounts): add get_full_name property to Profile model
- Expose full name as a computed property on Profile

feat(blog): enhance Post API with dynamic serialization and hypermedia URLs
- Add get_absolute_api_url to Post model for canonical API links - Implement CategorySerializer using ModelSerializer for JSON representation - Implement PostSerializer with context-aware output: • Show brief_content in list, full content in detail • Include relative/absolute URLs using request context - Auto-set author from authenticated user’s profile on create - Use SlugRelatedField for author and show author full name in output - Use SlugRelatedField for category and nested CategorySerializer in output - Register PostViewSet and CategoryViewSet with DefaultRouter - Add sample @action (get_ok) for future custom endpoints

feat(blog): enhance Post API with pagination, filtering, search, and object-level permissions
- Implement custom PostPagination with metadata (total pages, count, links) - Add IsOwnerOrReadonly permission: only post owner can edit/delete - Enable filtering via django-filter (category, author, status with 'in'/'exact') - Add full-text search on title/content and ordering by published_date - Configure all features in PostViewSet with proper security and usability

feat(docs): replace coreapi with drf-yasg for OpenAPI 3.0 documentation
- Install and configure drf-yasg in settings and urls - Enable Swagger UI and ReDoc endpoints for interactive API docs - Generate and save OpenAPI schema to output.json for external use - Align documentation with industry standards (OpenAPI/Swagger)

feat(dev): add script to generate realistic test data for local development
- Create 'create_test_data.py' with sample users, profiles, categories, and posts - Use get_or_create to avoid duplicates on re-run - Populate data with tech-themed content matching real-world scenarios - Enable quick setup of development environment with meaningful fixtures

feat(accounts): implement v1 API for user registration, token login, and logout
- Add registration endpoint with password confirmation and validation - Customize token auth to use email and return user profile info (name, email) - Implement secure logout by deleting auth token - Configure DRF TokenAuthentication in settings - Organize API under /api/v1/ with proper URL namespacing - Integrate with django.contrib.auth.urls for web-based auth flows

fix(docker): use 'python -m pip' for reliable dependency installation
- Replace 'pip install' with 'python -m pip install' in Dockerfile - Ensures consistent pip version aligned with the selected Python interpreter - Improves build reliability across different base images and environments

feat(accounts): implement JWT-based authentication with user profile and password change
- Integrate djangorestframework-simplejwt and configure in settings - Customize JWT login to include email and user_id in response - Add secure change-password endpoint with old-password verification - Enable profile retrieval and update via /api/v1/profile/ - Expose standard JWT endpoints: create, refresh, verify

refactor(accounts): split models and urls into separate files for better organization
- Improve code readability and maintainability in large-scale projects

feat(accounts): add is_verified flag to User model for email verification
- Introduce is_verified BooleanField with default=False - Expose field in Django admin for manual verification if needed - Apply database migration to persist the new field - Lay groundwork for email confirmation and restricted access flows

feat(dev): add smtp4dev to docker-compose for local email testing
- Integrate smtp4dev container as local SMTP/IMAP/POP3 server - Bind web UI to 127.0.0.1:5000 and SMTP to 127.0.0.1:2525 for security - Persist email data via smtp4dev-data volume - Enable safe, offline email verification testing in development

feat(accounts): implement secure email-based account activation flow
- Add activation_email.html template using django-mail-templated - Generate JWT-based activation tokens linked to user ID - Block login for unverified users in both JWT and Token auth - Implement activation/resend APIs with proper validation - Send emails asynchronously via EmailThread to avoid blocking - Integrate with smtp4dev for safe local email testing

feat(accounts): implement secure password reset via email with JWT tokens
- Add password reset request and confirm endpoints - Generate short-lived JWT tokens (15 min) with 'reset_password' type - Validate token type and expiration to prevent misuse - Send reset link via templated email using smtp4dev in development - Use generic success message to avoid user enumeration - Enforce Django password validation on reset

feat(docs): organize accounts API endpoints in Swagger with custom tags
- Apply @swagger_auto_schema to group auth, account registration,account activation, profile, and password management in accounts app - Use consistent tags for clear navigation - Improve developer experience with well-structured, self-documenting API docs

feat(docs): implement robust custom SwaggerAutoSchema for consistent API documentation
- Create CustomAutoSchema that unifies ViewSet and GenericAPIView documentation - Support dynamic tags, summaries, and descriptions via view attributes - Enable reliable operation labeling across all DRF view types - Apply consistent Swagger organization to blog and accounts APIs - Improve developer experience with accurate, well-structured API docs
fix(accounts): resolve TestEmailSend view reliability issue

feat(docs): enhance Swagger documentation for accounts and blog APIs
- Add consistent swagger_tags to all views for logical grouping - Provide clear operation summaries and descriptions - Standardize API documentation across both apps using CustomAutoSchema - Improve discoverability and usability of endpoints in Swagger UI

feat(auth): integrate Djoser as standardized v2 authentication API
- Install and configure djoser for robust, production-ready auth - Mount Djoser endpoints under /api/v2/ for clear versioning - Isolate v2 docs in Swagger with dedicated tags/prefix for clarity - Lay foundation for advanced features: social auth, token refresh, etc.

feat(tests): add comprehensive test suite for blog app
- Implement model tests for Post and Category creation - Add form validation tests for PostForm (valid/invalid cases) - Cover URL resolution for all blog views (index, list, detail) - Write view tests for authenticated vs anonymous access - Use proper TestCase/SimpleTestCase separation and setUp for DRY
